definition: the great Shaanxi earthquake of 2nd February 1556 that killed 830,000 people
abbr. for Shaanxi 陝西|陕西 province
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
to shake/to vibrate/to jolt/to quake/excited/shocked/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing thunder/☳
